content.description:
Sit start with a left hand crimp and a right hand sidepull/pinch.  From there, bump (initial bump, crux) a right hand up the arete using the jugs and finish straight up.

As a true sit start, the first move is where the difficulty comes from.  Getting far under the arete with a high right leg helps make it go though.
content.protection: A pad or two should do. There is a fallen, dead tree directly behind the problem, but the landing is good nonetheless.
content.location: It ascends the southeast arete of Peanut Butter and Jelly Boulder.

content.description:
Megapuppy climbs a slightly overhanging face on solid, incut crimps.

Sit start with hands matched in the incut crimp.  From there, make a big move up to the sloping incut crimps.  At that point, either dyno to the lip or use the small bumps to top it out.

The first move off the ground is the roughest. From there on, staying low on the sloping crimps is the key to making progress.
content.protection: A pad, the landing is fabulous though.
content.location: This is on the South face of PB & J Boulder.
